title: VIDEO EDITOR (B-Roll Research & Visual Design Specialist)
job_overview:
We’re hiring someone who has great creative taste and loves picking the perfect video clips to match a story.

If you’re good at finding B-roll that fits the mood, organizing footage so it’s easy to use, and helping make videos that look great and feel smooth, this could be for you.

—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.

--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---
Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!

--- ABOUT YOU ---
Do you have great creative taste and love finding the perfect B-roll to bring a story to life? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a strong sense of pacing, a passion for storytelling, and take pride in keeping media assets organized and easy to use? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?

Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!

Responsibilities:
Storytelling & Editing
- Review all raw assets (A-roll, B-roll, audio, graphics), interpret transcripts, and determine a cohesive story direction
- Create and maintain a shot list, pulling and organizing B-roll to enhance the narrative
- Edit clean, tight, publish-ready videos that align with brand guidelines
- Iterate quickly based on team feedback and meet agreed delivery timelines

B-Roll Research & Script Annotation
- Transcribe video content using tools provided or AI software
- Prepare clean transcript documents for each project
- Highlight key narrative Upgrade to see actual infonts and suggest relevant B-roll ideas
- Source B-roll from internal libraries, stock platforms (e.g., Envato, Pexels), or Creative Commons-approved YouTube content
- Link proposed B-roll clips directly into the transcript for easy editor access

Media Management & Organization
- Maintain a structured B-roll folder system by project and theme
- Rename and tag clips with accurate, searchable keywords (e.g., “Charlotte city aerial,” “family walking in park”)
- Keep a centralized, up-to-date B-roll database (Google Sheets, Notion, Airtable, etc.)
- Track reusable clips to reduce redundancy and improve efficiency

Requirements:
- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)
- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required
- Experience with Canva or Photoshop is a plus
- Strong grasp of storytelling, pacing, and visual rhythm required
- Experience organizing and pulling relevant B-roll to strengthen visual narratives, required
- Strong file organization habits and understanding of post-production workflows
- Portfolio of completed long-form video projects, required
- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required
- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required
- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required
- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required
- Growth mindset, required
